ws2d.util

Class UidSet<T extends UniquelyIdentifiableObject>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ws2d.util.UidSet<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of object to store.

    public class UidSet<T extends UniquelyIdentifiableObject>
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines a set in which each object has a unique ID, and in which the objects are accessed via their unique ID.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UidSet()
      Constructs a new instance of UidSet with the default capacity.
      UidSet(int initialCapacity)
      Constructs a new instance of UidSet with a specified initial capacity.

      Adds the object to the UID set and changes its UID to the appropriate value.
      void allocate(int amount)
      Ensures that the stack can support its current size plus the number of items specified.
      void deallocate(int amount)
      Shrinks the UID set by the specified amount.
      protected void ensureCapacity(int minCapacity)
      Ensures that the UID set can support the number of elements specified.
      void forEach(java.util.function.Consumer<? super T> action)
      Iterates through each of the elements in the UID set and performs an action with it.
      T get(int uid)
      Gets an object by UID.
      protected void grow(int minCapacity)
      Grows the UID set to fit the minimum required capacity.
      boolean insert(T object)
      Inserts the object into the UID set while preserving the UID of the object if possible.
      boolean isFull()
      Whether or not the UID set is full.
      T remove(int uid)
      Removes an object from this UID set by UID.
      void remove(T object)
      Removes an object from the UID set.
      java.util.stream.Stream<T> stream()
      Returns a stream of the elements in this UID set.
